action.action-desc: Mr. Paulsen introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Low-Income Housing Preservation and Resident Homeownership Act of 1990.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Preservation Enhancement and Savings Opportunity Act of 2014
.
Section 222 of the Low-Income Housing Preservation and Resident Homeownership Act of 1990 (12 U.S.C. 4112) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: After the date of the enactment of the Preservation Enhancement and Savings Opportunity Act of 2014 , the owner of a property subject to a plan of action or use agreement pursuant to this section shall be entitled to distribute—

subparagraph.text: annually, all surplus cash generated by the property; and

upon request made to the Secretary and notwithstanding any conflicting provision in such use agreement; any funds accumulated in a residual receipts account, but only if the owner is in material compliance with such use agreement.

paragraph.text: An owner that distributes any amounts pursuant to paragraph (1) shall—

subparagraph.text: continue to operate the property in accordance with the affordability provisions of the use agreement for the property for the remaining useful life of the property;
as required by the plan of action for the property, continue to renew or extend any project-based rental assistance contract for a term of not less than 20 years; and
if the owner has an existing multi-year project-based rental assistance contract for less than 20 years, have the option to extend the contract to a 20-year term.

section.text: Section 214 of the Low-Income Housing Preservation and Resident Homeownership Act of 1990 (12 U.S.C. 4104) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Neither this section, nor any plan of action or use agreement implementing this section, shall restrict an owner from obtaining a new loan or refinancing an existing loan secured by the project, or from distributing the proceeds of such a loan; except that, in conjunction with such refinancing—

paragraph.text: any resulting budget-based rent increase shall include debt service on the new financing, commercially reasonable debt service coverage, and replacement reserves as required by the lender; and
rent increases for units not covered by a project-based rental subsidy contract or tenant-based rental subsidy shall be limited to 10 percent.
